title: Woman ‘strangled man to death after he raped her’
text:
Evonne Sharkey, 37, said she strangled Steven Malone, 65, to death after she claimed he raped her. (Picture: St Paul Police/Kare 11)

A woman strangled a man to death after he allegedly raped her, police say.

Evonne Sharkey, 37, was arrested on Tuesday and charged with unintentional murder and manslaughter for 65-year-old Steven Dennis Malone’s death in St Paul, Minnesota on Sunday.

Sharkey told police that Malone raped her at his apartment after she met him in the park. She said she agreed to go to his apartment because he seemed like a ‘nice guy.’

Malone and Sharkey were joined by another woman at the apartment, where they smoked crack for the woman’s birthday.

Sharkey said the more Malone drank, the more he groped her. She said at some point he sexually assaulted her in his bathroom, KARE 11 reported.

Police arrested and interviewed Sharkey, then charged her with manslaughter and murder (Picture: Google Maps)

She said she fought back and ‘choked him out,’ according to the police complaint.

Sharkey said that she gathered her belongings while Malone was unconscious, but she said he came to and tried to sexually assault her again.

She said that she ‘choked him out’ a second time, then a third time after he regained consciousness again. Afterwards she tied him up with a curtain rope, duct tape, and gagged him with a towel.

Sharkey was later surprised when police told her that Malone was found dead and said ‘I never meant to hurt that man,’ according to the complaint.

The other woman who was at the apartment told police that Malone and Sharkey were having sex. She said she was asked to join, but she left after taking two hits of crack cocaine.

Prosecutors said Sharkey had small cuts and marks on her face and arm that indicated a struggle. She is due back in court on Thursday.
description: Evonne Sharkey, 37, is charged with unintentional murder and manslaughter for 65-year-old Steven Dennis Malone's death in Minnesota.
